info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 6 at 8:32AM EDT until May 6 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS State College PA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania...
Bald Eagle Creek near Beech Creek Station affecting Clinton and Centre Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Bald Eagle Creek near Beech Creek Station.
* WHEN...Until this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Overgrown pastures and agricultural fields on the left bank are affected by high water. At 11.0 feet, High water levels threaten the cottage area of Mill Hall downstream of Beech Creek Station. At 13.0 feet, Homes in the cottage area are isolated by high water from Bald Eagle Creek.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 11.1 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this afternoon.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING
